de.esoco.lib.comm

Class CommunicationMethod<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<L,O>
        • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractBinaryFunction<I,Connection,O>
          • de.esoco.lib.comm.CommunicationMethod<I,O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryFunction<I,Connection,O>, java.util.function.Function<I,O>, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommunicationChain, HttpEndpoint.HttpRequest, JsonRpcEndpoint.JsonRpcRequest, PipeEndpoint.PipeRequest, SocketEndpoint.SocketRequest

    public abstract class CommunicationMethod<I,O>
extends de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractBinaryFunction<I,Connection,O>
    Describes a method to communicate with an endpoint in the communication framework.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.esoco.lib.expression.BinaryFunction

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommunicationMethod

        public CommunicationMethod(java.lang.String sMethodName,
                           I rDefaultInput)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        sMethodName - The name of this method
        rDefaultInput - The default input for this method

    • Method Detail

      • doReceive

        public static <T> CommunicationMethod<java.lang.Void,T> doReceive(CommunicationMethod<?,T> fRequest)
        Converts a communication method with argument and return value into a method that ignores input values and only returns a remote value (analog to the Supplier interface). This can be used to wrap communication methods that don't have different input values but should always be invoked with their default input.
        Parameters:
        fRequest - The communication method that performs the actual request to receive data from the remote endpoint
        Returns:
        A new communication method with a void input

      • doSend

        public static <T> CommunicationMethod<T,java.lang.Void> doSend(CommunicationMethod<T,?> fRequest)
        Converts a communication method with argument and return value into a method that ignores return values and only transfers input values to a remote service (analog to the Consumer interface). This can be used to wrap communication methods that don't have a meaningful return value and should only be invoked to send values to an endpoint.
        Parameters:
        fRequest - The communication method that performs the actual request to send data to the remote endpoint
        Returns:
        A new communication method with a void return value

      • doOn

        public abstract O doOn(Connection rConnection,
                       I rInput)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be implemented by subclasses to perform the actual communication over a connection to execute this method. This method must always be invoked with explicit parameters. An implicit default input value will only be considered by the standard method AbstractBinaryFunction.evaluate(Object).
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The connection to communicate over
        rInput - The input value for this communication method
        Returns:
        The output value according to this method's definition
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any kind of exception may be thrown to signal errors

      • evaluate

        public final O evaluate(I rInput,
                        Connection rConnection)

      • from

        public EndpointFunction<I,O> from(Endpoint rEndpoint)
        Overloaded variant of Function.from(Function) that returns an instance of EndpointFunction.
        Parameters:
        rEndpoint - The endpoint to return the chain for
        Returns:
        A new endpoint chain that evaluates this method at the given endpoint

      • getDefaultInput

        public final I getDefaultInput()
        Returns the default input value of this method.
        Returns:
        The default input value

      • getFrom

        public O getFrom(Connection rConnection,
                 I rInput)
        A synonym for evaluate(Object, Connection) that can be used to indicate that a value is retrieved from an endpoint connection.
        See Also:
        evaluate(Object, Connection)

      • on

        public EndpointFunction<I,O> on(Endpoint rEndpoint)
        Semantic variant of from(Endpoint) that indicates that a communication method is executed at a certain endpoint.
        Parameters:
        rEndpoint - The endpoint
        Returns:
        The endpoint chain of this method with the given endpoint

      • sendTo

        public O sendTo(Connection rConnection,
                I rInput)
        A synonym for evaluate(Object, Connection) that can be used to indicate that a value is sent over an endpoint connection.
        See Also:
        evaluate(Object, Connection)

      • then

        public <T> CommunicationMethod<I,T> then(de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super O,T> fOther)
        Overloaded to return a special type of CommunicationMethod that can perform automatic resource handling for chained methods.
        See Also:
        Function.then(Function)

      • getLogMessage

        protected java.lang.String getLogMessage(Connection rConnection,
                                         I rInput,
                                         java.lang.Exception rException)
        Generates a message for this method that will be used if logging is enabled for the connection that this method is invoked upon. Subclasses can override this method to generate more specific log messages. Alternatively they may override getMethodDescription(Connection, Object) which will be invoked to get a description of this method for the log message.
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The current connection
        rInput - The input value for the method invocation
        rException - In the case of an error logging the exception that occurred or NULL for the (info) logging of a successful request
        Returns:
        The log message

      • getMethodDescription

        protected java.lang.String getMethodDescription(Connection rConnection,
                                                I rInput)
        Returns a description of this instance. this method be invoked by getLogMessage(Connection, Object, Exception) to get a description for log messages. It may be overridden to provide a more specific description.
        Parameters:
        rConnection - The current connection
        rInput - The input value for the method invocation
        Returns:
        The method description
